title: and of the Council of 5 September 20072, and Regulation (EU) 2017/745 of the
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities 

(Medical Devices) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2020. 

(2) The collective citation “the European Communities (Medical Devices) 

Regulations 1994 to 2020” includes these Regulations.

title: and of the Council of 5 September 20072, and Regulation (EU) 2017/745 of the
heading: 3. Article 12 (as amended by Regulation 3 of the European Communities
text_raw:
3. Article 12 (as amended by Regulation 3 of the European Communities 
(Medical Devices) (Amendment) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 144 of 2020)) of 
the Principal Regulations is amended— 

(a) 

(b) 

in subarticle (10), by substituting “public health or patient safety 
or health” for “protection of health”, and 

in subarticle (10A), by substituting “public health or patient 
safety or health” for “protection of public health”.

title: and of the Council of 5 September 20072, and Regulation (EU) 2017/745 of the
heading: 28. (1) The Competent Authority shall record and evaluate any
text_raw:
28. (1) The Competent Authority shall record and evaluate any 
information brought to its attention, in accordance with the provisions of 
the Directive or these Regulations, regarding the following incidents 
involving a Class I, IIa, IIb or III device: 

1 OJ No. L 169, 12.7.1993, p. 1. 
2 OJ No. L 247, 21.9.2007, p. 21. 
3 OJ No. L 117, 5.5.2017, p. 1. 
4 OJ No. L 130, 24.4.2020, p. 18. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th August, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 (a) 

(b) 

[301] 3 

any malfunction or deterioration in the characteristics or 
performance of a device, as well as any inadequacy in the 
labelling or the instructions for use which might lead to or 
might have led to the death of a patient or user or to a serious 
deterioration in his or her state of health; and 

technical or medical reason 

any 
the 
characteristics or performance of a device for the reasons 
referred to in paragraph (a), leading to systematic recall of 
devices of the same type by the manufacturer. 

in relation 

to 

(2) After carrying out an assessment, if possible together with the 
manufacturer or his or her authorised representative, the Competent 
Authority shall, without prejudice to Article 19(A), immediately inform 
the Commission and the other Member States of measures that have been 
taken or are contemplated to minimise recurrence of the incidents 
referred to in subarticle (1), including information on the underlying 
incidents.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

6 August, 2020. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [301]

title: and of the Council of 5 September 20072, and Regulation (EU) 2017/745 of the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to give effect to Regulation 59(1) of 
Regulation (EU) 2017/745 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 5 
April 2017, as amended by Regulation (EU) 2020/561 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 23 April 2020. In addition, these Regulations 
implement Article 10 of Council Directive 93/42/EEC of 14 June 1993 in the 
State. 

These Regulations amend the European Communities (Medical Devices) 
Regulations 1994. 

These Regulations may be cited as the European Communities (Medical 
Devices) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2020.
